13th Jun, COVID-19 preventative measures and restrictions are still in effect in some destinations.  These could include:  - curfews, movement restrictions, or lockdowns  - mandatory mask use  - required proof of vaccination or a COVID-19 test result to access public and private services and spaces  Before travelling, verify if specific restrictions or requirements are still in effect.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220621193017/https://travel.gc.ca/destinations/sri-lanka

Nepal schools reopened on February 13th. In late April, the 10th-grade students completed their Secondary Education Examination (SEE) in Nepal.  Till the time they join higher education, there is a break of around three months.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220214234133/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/south-asia/schools-reopen-in-nepal-as-third-wave-of-covid-weakens/articleshow/89540371.cms  https://web.archive.org/web/20220530221031/https://english.onlinekhabar.com/school-student-use-break-productively.html

There are no restrictions on movements within Nepal with a vaccination certificate. Local and private transportation are available. Public transport and personal vehicles, including taxis, are permitted in the Kathmandu valley and must adhere to COVID protocols.  Violations of local orders may result in penalties. Long distance buses may be operating in some areas of the country. Additional restrictions remain possible in many locations.   https://web.archive.org/web/20220606211735/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220307201443/http://www.xinhuanet.com/asiapacific/20220305/c56196aabeb8455abff9a196d31a61d3/c.html

Vaccinated visitors must present a certificate showing a negative RT-PCR test, taken within 72 hours of flight of first departure.  Unvaccinated people, or those unable to show that they have been fully vaccinated for at least fourteen days, are subject to free antigen tests on arrival. According to MoH Nepal, as of mid June 2022, 77.1% of the population have received the 1st dose and 68.6% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/  21 more million doses to be delivered by June 2022:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220131191839/https://mohp.gov.np/attachments/article/811/NEPAL%20COVID-19%20EMERGENCY%20RESPONSE%20AND%20HEALTH%20SYSTEMS.pdf    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/

According to MoH Nepal, as of mid June 2022, 77.5% of the population have received the 1st dose and 69% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/    US donates 2.2 million doses of Pediatric COVID-19 vaccines to Nepal:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220620223334/https://thehimalayantimes.com/kathmandu/us-donates-22-million-doses-of-pediatric-covid-19-vaccines-to-nepal

According to MoH Nepal, as of late June 2022, 78.3% of the population have received the 1st dose and 69.5% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster, after six months of booster campaign.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/    Government began massively administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for children 5-12 on June 23th:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220627191919/https://myrepublica.nagariknetwork.com/news/covid-19-vaccine-to-be-administered-to-children-in-the-5-12-age-group-from-today/    US donates 2.2 million doses of Pediatric COVID-19 vaccines to Nepal:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220620223334/https://thehimalayantimes.com/kathmandu/us-donates-22-million-doses-of-pediatric-covid-19-vaccines-to-nepal

According to MoH Nepal, as of early July 2022, 80.1% of the population have received the 1st dose and 69.9% are fully vaccinated.
